meanings.definition: The act of sublating or raising up.
meanings.sent1: The sublations of the books onto the shelves made the room look tidy.
meanings.sent2: I observed the sublations of the balloons as they floated higher and higher.
meanings.sent3: The sublations of the cupcakes onto the table caused everyone to smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the sublations of joy filling the room.
meanings.sent5: The sublations of the sun over the horizon painted the sky in beautiful colors.

meanings.definition: Something that is sublated or raised up.
meanings.sent1: The heavy box was one of the sublations we needed to move.
meanings.sent2: The treehouse was a delightful sublations in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The sublations of the cookies from the oven filled the house with a sweet aroma.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was a sublations that lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The sublations of the hot air balloon brought a sense of adventure to the day.

meanings.definition: The process of sublating or raising up.
meanings.sent1: The sublations of the dough in the oven transformed it into a delicious bread.
meanings.sent2: We watched the sublations of the rocket as it launched into space.
meanings.sent3: The sublations of the flowers in the garden made it look more vibrant.
meanings.sent4: The sublations of ideas in the meeting led to a creative solution.
meanings.sent5: The sublations of the tide revealed hidden treasures on the shore.
